availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Andrew J. Marcum (Lawrence County, Kentucky, farmer.)

body.p: Lawrence County, Kentucky, farmer, soldier, and justice of the peace. Kentucky native. Married to Marinda Roberts Marcum. Father of Francis Marcum, Sinclare Marcum, Elizabeth Marcum, Anna Marcum, and Lyda Marcum. Farmer in Lawrence County in 1850. Farmer in Lawrence County in 1860. Justice of the peace in Lawrence County in 1861. Served in the 5th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (C.S.A) as a private from December 27, 1861 to June 9, 1862. Farmer in Lawrence County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lawrence County, p. 152.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, X County, p. 578.
Compiled Service Records of Confederate Soldiers Who Served in Organizations from the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 109, Microfilm Series M319, Roll 0110.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Lawrence County, KY, October 1863, p. 106.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994044, Lawrence County Births.
KYR-0001-017-0287.
